channel.title: Server Compile error?
channel.description:
First off sorry if this is in the wrong section but anyway.
I went to compile a source i have been workin on and well i got this [img]http://C:\Users\Aaron\Pictures\cmd error.jpg[/img] the rest [img]http://C:\Users\Aaron\Pictures\cmd error2.jpg[/img] Now i think i just missed somthing but i have no idea. It was workin fine erlier and now im at a loss.

item.title: Server Compile error?
item.dc:creator: @adecker adecker
item.description:
@adecker wrote:

I like notepadd ++ which declaration. TRY or Catch? where exactly?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 25, 2009, 08:58:34 pm[/size][hr]SOLVED i used netbeans thanks “the elve age!”

Read full topic

item.title: Server Compile error?
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

A) Use NetBeans to code, it fixed all errors. And shows how to code properly.

B) You missed a bracket. Before the declaration

Read full topic

item.title: Server Compile error?
item.dc:creator: @adecker adecker
item.description:
@adecker wrote:

No, the bracked was at the top.

the try

try { String playerCommand = p.stream.readString().toLowerCase(); String[] cmd = playerCommand.split(" "); {

the catch

} //===============================END OF ADMIN COMMANDS==================================================
        } catch (Exception error) {
            error.printStackTrace();
        }
    }

some of those } link to other parts[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 25, 2009, 08:30:05 pm[/size][hr]uh hello??

Read full topic

item.title: Server Compile error?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

‘Try without catch or finally’…

For each try statement, you need a catch clause in case an exception is thrown.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Compile error?
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

If that bracket is located at the bottom you should remove it, as the class is already closed.

Read full topic
